questions.question: How long have humans lived on this continent (now called Australia)?

choices.answer: About 20 - 30 years
About 250 years
About 20 000 years
About 40 000 - 60 000 years

questions.question: Some of the artefacts found at occupation sites include...

choices.answer: Stone tools
Food remains
Fireplaces
All of the other answers combined
A midden is like a medium sized kitten
A midden is the remains of a body
A midden is a pile of old rubbish
A midden is a type of weapon

questions.question: Some of the ways that Aboriginal people buried their dead include...

choices.answer: Burial in ground or caves
Cremated and shot into space
Entombed in a pyramid
Buried with an army of clay warriors
People passing on stories and songs without using writing
People passing on sacred pairs of pants
People passing on information by writing or by rock art
People passing on their stone tools or tool kits.

questions.question: In what state can you visit the Lake Mungo National Park?

choices.answer: NSW
QLD
VIC
SA

questions.question: Historians believe people were living in the Mungo region as many as _____________ years ago.
How was the body of 'Mungo Lady' prepared when she died?

choices.answer: She was cremated and her bones smashed into pieces.
She was buried with flowers and the body of her pet dog.
She was placed into a golden coffin wearing a stone mask.
She was placed in a wooden boat and pushed onto the lake.

questions.question: Which answer would be the best description of the image?

choices.answer: Beautiful Lake Grant on Mars
Lake Mungo as it appeared 45 000 years ago
Lake Mungo as it appears today
The Sahara desert

questions.question: Which groups have benefited from the discoveries of Mungo Lady and Mungo Man?

choices.answer: The local peoples, Barkindji, Nyiampaa and Mutthi Mutthi
Archaeologists around the world
Modern Australians like you and me
All of the other answers combined
